result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:14 PM (64-06) Defendant Eva M Lawson in court.  Attorney Steven C. Spear in court for Eva M Lawson.  Attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive her right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives her right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Arraignment held in open Court.
Attorney Spear acknowledge receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.
Speedy Trial reserved.

Adj. 2:17PM

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Eva M Lawson in court.  Attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 1:57 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for initial appearance. Complaint provided to the Defendant and Court goes over charges and penalties. Discussion as to right to attorney. Court sets out few weeks for defendant to obtain counsel. Court in recess.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money
Signed bond filed with the court.
See signature bond for conditions

DEFENDANT MUST POST $500 CASH

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH J.F.D. OR RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Eva M Lawson in court, in custody by video. James Sempf appeared for the State. Attorney Obi Uzowulu appeared for defendant. Defendant's oldest daughter present in court. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
